formName: Application for Authorised Economic Operator (Part 2 C118-questionnaire)

fields.infoText: Answer the following five questions to check if you are eligible to apply for AEO status

fields.label: Does your accounting (logistic) system facilitate a full audit trail of your customs activities or tax relevant movement of goods or accounting entries?
Do you have documented procedures for verifying the accuracy of customs declarations, including those submitted on your behalf, for example, by a customs agent or a freight forwarder?
fields.shortName: Procedures for verifying accuracy of customs declarations

fields.label: Does your company have instructions or guidelines on the notification of irregularities to the competent authorities (for example, suspicion of theft, burglary or smuggling in connection with customs-related goods)?
fields.shortName: Company has guidelines on the notification of irregularities

fields.label: Do you or the person in charge of your customs matters have practical experience of a minimum of 3 years in customs matters?
fields.shortName: Experienced person in charge of customs matters

fields.label: Do you have documented stocktaking and procedures for dealing with irregularities?
fields.shortName: Documented stocktaking and procedures for dealing with irregularities

fields.label: Basic eligibility successfully passed
fields.infoText:
You have passed the basic eligibility checker. 

 Continue with the rest of the application form

fields.label: Basic eligibility failed
fields.infoText:
You have not passed the basic eligibility checker. 

 Do not continue with the rest of the application form until you can answer yes to all five previous questions
We need your consent before using email to communicate

fields.label: Read about the risks of using email
fields.infoText:
HMRC takes the security of personal information very seriously.

The main risks of using email that concern HMRC are as follows.

Confidentiality/privacy - there is a risk that email sent over the internet may be intercepted.

Confirming your identity - it is crucial that we only communicate with established business contacts at their correct email addresses.

There is no guarantee that an email received over an insecure network, like the internet, has not been altered during transit.

We will desensitise information wherever possible, for example by only quoting part of any unique reference numbers.

fields.label: By clicking yes you confirm that you have a clear understanding and acceptance of the risks associated with email, and that you are content for us to send information concerning your business details.
fields.shortName: Confirm consent to use email communication

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: Provide your email address below if you consent to communicating by email

fields.label: Full name of email contact

sections.title: Preparation questions
sections.shortName: Have you got all the information you need?

fields.infoText:
Please read the [European Commission’s Authorised Economic Operator (AEO) Guidelines](https://ec.europa.eu/taxation_customs/sites/taxation/files/resources/documents/customs/policy_issues/customs_security/aeo_guidelines_en.pdf) before applying for AEO.

 You will need to press back in your browser to get back to this form

fields.label: Which departments, including management, have you involved in the process to prepare your company for the AEO application?
fields.helpText: Have you involved customs or third parties in the process (consultants etc)?

fields.label: What authorisation do you require?

fields.errorMessage: You must select customs simplification, security and safety or both

fields.label: Your trader identification number is the same as your Economic Operator Registration and Identification (EORI) number
EORI Number
Member states country codes
fields.infoText:
Find the required [member state country codes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/uk-trade-tariff-country-and-currency-codes/uk-trade-tariff-country-and-currency-codes#a) here 

 You will need to press back in your browser to get back to this form

fields.helpText: Enter your country code, for example GB
Enter your 12 numerical digit EORI number

fields.infoText: State the name, address, date of establishment/registration and legal status of the organisation of the applying company. Please include the web page address (URL) of your company’s website, if applicable.

fields.label: Company name
Company address
Date of establishment
Legal status
Company website
Is your company part of a group?
fields.helpText: Select yes if your company is part of a group

fields.label: Provide a brief description of the group
Do any other entities in the group already have an AEO authorisation?
Have any other entities in the group already applied for AEO status and are currently undergoing an AEO audit by a national customs authority?
Does the application cover Permanent Business Establishments (PBE's)
Site full name
Full address of permanent business establishment

fields.label: VAT registration number(s)
fields.helpText: Input GB and then the 9 numerical digits of the permanent business establishment's VAT registration number(s)

Provide details of the reorganisation of your company

sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (Guidelines Annex 2, point 2.9)

fields.label: Briefly describe what actions have been taken in order to protect information/documents from unauthorised access, abuse, intended destruction and loss (for example, constricted access rights, creation of electronic backup, clear-desk policy)
Have there been any cases of unauthorised access to documents in the last year?

sections.title: Documentation security - incident of unauthorised access occurred

fields.label: What measures have been taken to prevent this from happening again?
fields.shortName: Measures taken to prevent re-occurrance of unauthorised access to documents

fields.label: Which categories of employees have access to detailed data about the flow of materials and goods?
fields.shortName: categories of employees with access to detailed material and goods flow data

fields.label: Which categories of employees are authorised to change this data?
fields.shortName: categories of employees authorised to change this data

fields.label: Are changes to this data comprehensively documented?

Briefly describe what requirements regarding security and safety you require from your trade partners and other contact persons in order to avoid abuse of information, for example, endangering of the supply chain through unauthorised transfer of shipping details
Are security declarations/agreements in place with your trade partners?

sections.title: Trade partners - security declarations/agreements not in place

fields.label: How do you ensure the safety and security of information and/or goods?
fields.shortName: How safety and security of information and/or goods is ensured

sections.title: Financial solvency
sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (Article 39 (c) UCC, Article 26 UCC IA, AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section III)

fields.label: Have any bankruptcy or insolvency proceedings been initiated in respect of your company's assets in the last 3 years?
fields.shortName: Bankruptcy or insolvency proceedings initiated in the last 3 years

fields.label: Provide details of the bankruptcy or insolvancy proceedings that have been initiated in the last 3 years
Has your company had a consistently good financial standing within the meaning of Article 26 of the UCC IA, sufficient to meet its financial commitments, over the last 3 years?

sections.title: Financial solvency -  not consistently good financial standing

fields.label: Provide full details of your financial standing and why it does not meet the consisitently good financial standing within the meaning of Article 26 of the UCC IA, sufficient to meet its financial commitments, over the last 3 years
fields.shortName: Full details of your financial standing

fields.infoText:
If you are a newly established business, provide all records and information in relation to your financial status. For example, latest cash flow, balance sheet and profit and loss forecasts approved by the directors/partners/sole proprietor.

 We accept documents in formats like pdf and jpeg (5mb maximum).

fields.label: Upload your latest cash flow
Upload your latest balance sheet
Upload your latest profit and loss forecasts

sections.title: Financial solvency in the foreseeable future

fields.label: Is there anything you are aware of that could impact on your financial solvency in the foreseeable future?
fields.shortName: Aware of anything that could impact future financial solvency

fields.shortName: Details of your things that may impact future financial solvency

Enter your deferment approval number (DAN)

sections.title: Practical standards of competence or professional qualifications
sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (Article 39 (d) UCC, Article 27 UCC IA, AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section IV)

fields.label: Do you or the person in charge of your customs matters have practical experience of a minimum of 3 years in customs matters?
fields.shortName: Experienced person in charge of customs matters

sections.shortName: Person in charge of customs matters

sections.shortName: Practical standards of competence - quality standard

fields.label: Do you or the person in charge of your customs matters comply with a quality standard concerning customs matters adopted by a European Standardisation body, when available?
fields.shortName: Experienced person in charge of customs matters

fields.label: Provide details on this quality standard.

fields.infoText: Have you or the person in charge of your customs matters successfully completed training covering customs legislation consistent with, and relevant to, the extent of your involvement in customs-related activities, provided by any of the following:

fields.label: A customs authority of a Member State
fields.shortName: Training provided by a customs authority of a member state

fields.label: An educational establishment recognised, for the purposes of providing such qualification, by the customs authorities or a body of a Member State responsible for professional training
fields.shortName: Training provided by a recognised educational establishment

fields.label: A professional or trade association recognised by the customs authorities of a Member State or accredited in the Union, for the purposes of providing such qualification?

provide details regarding the training, provided by an educational establishment , you or the person in charge of your customs matters have successfully completed.
provide details regarding the training, provided by a professional or trade association , you or the person in charge of your customs matters have successfully completed.

sections.title: Security and safety requirements
sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (Article 39 (e) UCC, Article 28 UCC IA, AEO Guidelines Part 2, Section V)

fields.label: Provide the name and the position of the person competent for safety and security related questions
fields.shortName: Competent person for safety and security matters

fields.label: Have you carried out a risk and threat assessment for your business?
fields.shortName: Risk and threat assessment carried out

fields.label: Is there a security plan in place for each site, where appropriate?
fields.shortName: Security plan in place for each site

fields.label: How often are those documents reviewed and updated?

Briefly describe what security risks (within the company or in your business dealings with customers, suppliers and external service providers) you have identified in relation to the AEO security criteria
Briefly describe how security measures are implemented and coordinated in your company?
fields.shortName: how security measures are implemented and coordinated

fields.label: Who is responsible for implementing and coordinating them?
If you have several premises in your company, is the implementation of the security measures harmonised in all of these locations?
Do you have any security instructions? How are they communicated to your staff and people visiting your company premises?
How are they documented (manual, work guidelines, information sheet, and so on)?
Have you had any security incidents?
Give a brief description of the incidents and what measures you have introduced to prevent them from reoccurring
Do you keep records of security incidents and the measures taken?
fields.shortName: Records of security incidents and measures taken kept

fields.label: Have you already been certified/authorised/approved by another public agency or authority for (transport, civil aviation, etc) security purposes?
fields.shortName: Already certified/authorised/approved by another public agency for security purposes.

fields.label: Give details of the premises/sites, which are covered by the relevant security purposes certificate/authorisation/approval
Provide a list of any independently accredited standards/licences/authorisations that you adhere to and specify what control/audits these standards are subject to
Have you planned to apply or have you already applied for any other certification/authorisation/approval for security purposes (eg regulated agent, known consignor, etc
fields.shortName: Previous application for any other certification for security purposes.

fields.label: Provide details of previous applications
Are there particular security and safety requirements for the goods you are importing/exporting?
fields.shortName: Details of particular security and safety requirements

fields.label: Do you use the services of a security company? If so, which company do you use?
Has this company made a threat assessment of your company? If so, describe briefly what security risks they have identified in relation to the AEO security criteria
Do your customers or insurance company impose any safety and security requirements on you?
Provide details of the requirements imposed

sections.title: Building security
sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section V, Subsection 2)

fields.label: Give a brief description of how the external boundary of your company’s premises is secured
How is compliance with these procedures checked?
fields.shortName: Compliance with these procedures is checked by

fields.label: How, by whom and at what intervals are checks carried out on the fences and buildings?
How are these checks and their results recorded?
fields.shortName: Building and fence checks recorded by

fields.label: How are security incidents reported and dealt with?
fields.shortName: Security incidents reported and dealt with by

fields.label: What types of access are there to your business premises?
fields.shortName: Types of access to business premises

fields.label: How are these managed?
Are access points restricted to time/day?
Are the premises adequately illuminated (for example, continuous light, movement sensors, twilight switch)?
Enter details of premises illuminations
How is the administration of keys handled in your company (for example, location, access, logging)?
Does written documentation exist for this?
Is the parking of private vehicles permitted on the premises?
Give details of which persons are permitted to park on the premises
Who gives the approval for permitted parking
Are the vehicles checked (at the entrance to the premises or at the car park entrance)?
Do written regulations exist?

sections.title: Building security - Access to premises
sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section V, Subsection 3)

fields.label: Briefly describe how the process of access to your premises (buildings, production areas, warehouses, and so on) is regulated for staff, visitors, other persons, vehicles and goods?
fields.shortName: How the process of accesss to premises is regulated

fields.label: Who checks that the prescribed procedures are complied with?
fields.shortName: Person who checks compliance with prescribed procedures

fields.label: How are these procedures communicated to the staff (eg action plan, manual, working guidelines, training)?

fields.label: If applicable, provide details of any other companies that are co-located on your premises
fields.shortName: How the procedures are communicated to the staff
fields.helpText: If not applicable enter N/A

fields.label: Briefly describe what measures are in place to prevent unauthorised access to and tampering with cargo units (particularly in open storage areas, for example, constant supervision, training staff and making them aware of risks, seals, instructions on procedures to follow in the case of unauthorised entry)

sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section V, Subsection 4)

fields.label: Briefly describe the procedure for ensuring the security and safety of incoming goods
fields.shortName: Procedures for ensuring safety of incoming goods

fields.label: Briefly describe how the compliance with these procedures is checked

Are incoming goods sealed, if appropriate?

Are the incoming goods marked?

sections.title: Personnel security
sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section V, Subsection 6)

fields.label: Briefly describe how your employment policy deals with security and safety requirements?

sections.description: Guidance for this section can be found at (AEO Guidelines Part 2 Section V, Subsection 7)

fields.infoText: You must complete form C117 to become an authorised economic operator
Click on the link below to go to the C117 form
Apply to become an [Authorised economic operator for imports or exports](https://www.gov.uk/guidance/authorised-economic-operator-certification) here

When you have completed and sent the C117 form return to this form and submit it

 Both forms should be submitted on the same day

fields.label: I have completed and sent form C117

sections.title: Form C117 must be completed and sent before you continue

fields.infoText:
You must have completed and sent form C117 before you can return this form.

Both forms should be submitted on the same day.

declarationSection.title: Confirm details and send your return

fields.label: Full name
Job title
Email address
fields.helpText: We will send an email to this address to confirm we’ve received your C118 application

fields.infoText:
# Declaration 
By submitting this application, you declare that the information that you have provided is true and complete.
This is your last opportunity to print or save a copy of your submitted form as you won’t be able to retrieve it later.
